Reviews.Title: “Near the attractions but still not noisy”
Reviews.Author: Khaled K
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has a very nice location, just behind the famous DAM square, but in a quiter street, although the tram pass right infront of it, but Amsterdam trams make no noises!!! The Hotel is Value for money and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fab hotel, clean, great decor, great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: xxblondie82xx
Reviews.Content: Me & my partner stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. ( for my 30th birthday) The location is perfect as it's just one street back from the main street (the dam rack). We booked the hotel through one of the tours & tickets shops when we got there and from what I could tell we got it considerably cheaper than walking in off the street. The breakfast was lovely too. Without a shadow of a doubt I would defiantly stay at this hotel again if I was to go back to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Keri_Cadden Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I travelled here with friends, in what was possibly the coldest weather Amsterdam had seen in years! The hotel was in a great location though, about a 10 minute walk from the train station, and approx 10 minutes from the Red Light District. The beds were amazingly comfortable, a lot better than a normal bed away from home! The staff were friendly, with our room being ready early as requested. The only down side was although the room was warm, the bathroom was freezing ....but there was plenty of hot water which helped to warm us up! A must visit, is O'Reilys Irish bar, not far from the hotel, down the same street away from the station - great staff, great food, and reasonable priced food and drink compared to some places!! Enjoy your visit, we did - I would use this hotel again, as reasonable, and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: helenjcarr
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean, great decor will stay at this hotel again recommended! Not bang in the centre but only short walk to red light,

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Linhbo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 5am after leaving our dodgy hostel. The staff here were very accomodating and helpful. Great breakfast and really comfy beds! Also fantastic location. Definitely would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: joanneshannon75
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a group of 13 girls away for a birthday weekend. Chose this hotel as one of the only ones displaying actual cost per night (others did not include all taxes). It was a great choice. Within walking distance of Central Station and all attractions and directly on the tram route although we didn't need to use them. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated - all with individual themes. Bar was ideal for meeting up before going out. Breakfast was served between 7-10am with lots on offer. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Checkout time 12 noon with secure facilities to leave luggage. I would definitely visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good place overall, small rooms though”
Reviews.Author: LucisInFundus
Reviews.Content: We walked into Hotel Citadel after running away from an Airbnb reservation that turned out to be awful. We were lucky enough to find a room, 2 days before New Year's. The room was clean, very hot!, and the balcony was very pleasant to have, with view on the street and everything going on there. I have to say that the by pictures they have on the site, the rooms look a lot bigger than they really are, we stayed in the "deluxe" room because that's all they had left, and even that one was small. It looked like an old fashion hotel that was at some point modernized, but the space just isn't enough. Breakfast is included and it's decent. Our room was right on the main street so it was not too quiet, also considering the time of the year, but apparently the rooms on the other side are a lot quieter. Overall we were satisfied. The best thing is the location. You don't have to spend any money on transportation and you can walk to the hotel at any time if you're feeling tired, without having to walk too much from any part of town you're in.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, poor room.”
Reviews.Author: Greig M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over Hogmanay 2011/12. Booked a single room but was upgraded by the very nice receptionist to a double. However, I think I would've preferred a single bed with more space, the room was tiny! The location of the hotel is fantastic, only a few minutes walk from Central Station. The breakfast was standard continental European - boring but consistent and tasty enough. The room was average at best, it's clearly had a fairly recent renovation, but has been done very cheaply. Overall though, it was a decent hotel for the price, but don't expect to be doing anything other than sleeping in your room! Oh and one more thing, the rooms are very dark! There were three lights in my room, but turning on each was like lighting a very weak, small candle...

Reviews.Title: “The smallest room in the world”
Reviews.Author: paris-eric
Reviews.Content: The Citadel Hotel is located in the heart of Amsterdam, at a walking distance from Central Station. I had booked a single room at a very good price by Internet. As I had asked for a quiet room (only one night for business in Amsterdam), I were warned by the receptionist that, in an effort to satisfy my request, the room allocated to me was small but quiet with a nice view. Everything was exact - small, well very small, probably less than 10 square meter, with a great view over central Amsterdam. I had the strange feeling to sleep in a attic, far from everything. Claustrophib people should avoid such a room, but really it was ok for me. The breakfast was great, with a huge variety of choice, I really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: geoff k
Reviews.Content: Great location, really central and close to everything. The staff were so helpful and friendly from the moment we arrived. Even though our second floor room faced the main road there was no excessive noise. The twin bedded room was very clean, the beds comfortable and, how nice to have heating you could actually control. We really enjoyed the buffet breakfast, great choice of food and drinks. Now we have found this hotel we will not stay anywhere else in Amsterdam and will recommend it to our friends. Once more, a BIG thank you to all the friendly staff for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: world_traveller9
Reviews.Content: Great central location, but the single room was so small I could touch both walls with my arms outstretched ( I kid you not!). Also, tired bathroom and decor. Would I stay again? Only if I couldn't find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here dead rat in my wardrobe”
Reviews.Author: thejam
Reviews.Content: Stayed weekend of the 28th to the 30th October hotel cost was Â£105.00 per night for a single bed in an extremely small room one morning there wasn't any hot water so had to get a cold shower, opened wardrobe door on second day to find a dead rat I was totally shocked I was moved to a much larger room no apology nothing I am totally disgusted with management no refund nothing plus the new room was 4 times the size and at the same price totally unacceptable Please do not book this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel in Super Location”
Reviews.Author: RonGHaifa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 7 nights at this hotel during October. The front desk staff were extremely helpful in giving us directions to the various tourist sights. The rooms are small compared to U. S. standards but this is often so in Amsterdam. Beds were comfortable and bathroom featured shower and tub combination in our double room. Since the hotel is on a busy street, I would recommend a room in the back. Although lacking in view, the nights were totally quiet. The elevator is quite convenient and the breakfast included in the room rate was adequate but somewhat lacking in variety. There is a large screen TV on the wall but aside from the BBC, no CNN of Fox News stations for American tastes. I would suggest an electric pot in the room for preparing coffee or tea. We were able to walk to all of the main sights and museums as the hotel is in a most convenient location between Dam Square and the Central Train Station. We would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for all”
Reviews.Author: topcoptiger
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 5 mates in two rooms of three singles in each, I spent hours as most do looking through websites to try and find a decent hotel, but until you get here you never know what its going to be like. The hotel is great, the rooms are in good condition having just been refurbished, they are not roomy, but you dont spend anytime in them to notice. Good en-suite, big flat screen on the wall and free internet in the lobby or you can pay for wi-fi in your room. I booked through Hotels.com and we had breakfast included, we left our luggage in the free, secure storage for the entire day until we had to leave. The hotel is 15 minutes by foot from train station and 5 minutes from the hussle and bussle of the shops and red light district. This is good for families, couples solo and groups, thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: smartbird24
Reviews.Content: The Citadel is approximately a 10 minute walk from the Centraal Railway Station in Amsterdam and is literally on the main tram route, making it very accessible and easy to find for first time visitors like ourselves. It's in a great location and within walking distance of everything you'll want to see in Amsterdam. If walking's not your thing, the transport links are great and the tram stops outside of the hotel. We stayed in a triple room with our teenage daughter and found it to be clean and pleasantly decorated, with a huge wall mounted TV and a decent shower. The room was very small, as has been commented on by other visitors, but as we spent very little time in the room, it didn't really matter. The beds were very comfortable (the double was actually two singles pushed together) and the room (Rm 47) was at the rear of the building, so was very quiet. The only complaint we had was that the temperature in room and the thick quilts made it far too warm to get a decent night's sleep. The buffet breakfast was included in the price and was standard continental fayre. On the down side, there was one over whelmed waitress and one over worked toaster to serve around 40 - 50 guests. This caused queues for guests waiting for a clear table and for those wanting a slice toast. The reception staff were very helpful, offering to book us tickets at Boom Chicago (comedy club - highly recommended) and printing our boarding passes for the flight home. The hotel check out time is noon, but we were able to leave our bags at the hotel until our outgoing flight at 10pm. Overall, I would recommend the hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lambi
Reviews.Content: A good 3-star hotel centrally located. What we liked most was the comfortable beds and a good breakfast. Friendly staff too. Small room and bathroom, but this did not matter much to us.

Reviews.Title: “IF HEINEKEN DID HOTELS ..........”
Reviews.Author: Inspector043
Reviews.Content: We have visited Amsterdam on 19 occasions in 19 years and yes stayed at the Citadel on 19 seperate occasions. The location, accomodation, cleanliness and excellent staff make this hotel our first choice year after year. During this period many changes have taken place within the hotel and the recent refurbishment has only served to further reinforce our opinion of this little gem. Many of the staff are long serving ({ I didn't say old ! } which is pleasing given a trade that normally has a high turnover of staff. Particular mention should be made of the the cleaners and reception staff Laney and Jessica who are both accommodating and professional in their approach. Indeed their efforts make this place a gourmet smorgasboard of hotel theory and practice. See you in February 2012 !! If Heineken did hotels ....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Clean Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MegMcD12
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was extremely friendly, and the hotel itself was very clean and comfortable. The complimentary breakfast provided each morning was delicious-- fresh bread, fruit, ham, cheese, yogurt, coffee, and juice! Also, the location of the hotel was right in the middle between the Centraal Station and Dam Square--perfect!! Everything was a short walk away. Wifi service was very cheap-- 1 euro/minute! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for us!”
Reviews.Author: Wizzie44
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant 3 days here, very comfortable room even if it was a tad cosy size! Good heating for the wintry snap. A kettle etc would have been a nice addition. Breakfast was perfectly adequate, in fact better than we expected, although it was rather budget products, They even allowed us an early start at 6.45 am when we had to head for the airport. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. Wi-fi at 2 euros per hour was cheap enough compared to business hotels but I think they should offer it free in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “absolutley fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MISCAL
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed at the citadel hotel for 6 nights. Our room was lovely and clean and beds were really comfortable. The staff were all lovely and breakfast was continental of which you had lots of choice. Rooms were cleaned on a daily basis. All in all a fantastic hotel and i would recommend it to anyone. Michelle Smith Weston super Mare

Reviews.Title: “Not luxury, but definately not the pits.”
Reviews.Author: Androdas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on for my mates stag party, it is quite basic but it is quiet and clean. It is close to the city centre and the red light district. the breakfast was continental style buffet.

Reviews.Title: “not 3 star but good location”
Reviews.Author: HelTraveller
Reviews.Content: Citadel is very conveniently located in the centre of the city and just about 5-10 minutes walk from the central train station. Tram stop is in the front of hotel if walking is not your cup of tea. It is true that there is a weird smell inside the building, kind of a wet dog or something. Decent lift took us to the top floor (7th) were our room was located. Couldn't hear any noise from the street, but the fire alarm of our next door neighbour went off. There was a nice view over the roofs. Room itself was small, however it was one of the only rooms I've ever been having hooks on the wall to hang jackets! Beds were separate (not double) and kept pulling away from each other, but otherwise very comfortable. Somehow there was room also for wardrobe, 2 chairs and a desk. Bathroom was very small. After having a shower it was like a swimming pool when water didn't go into to drain but was floating on the floor. A tool to wipe the floor (a squeegee?) would have been nice, but while there was no such thing, a towel had to be used to dry the floor. Buffet breakfast was 7,50 â‚¬ per person and included basic things like coffee, tea and orange juice, bread, ham, cheese, sliced tomatoes and cucumber, boiled eggs, cereal and yoghurt. Breakfast area was packed, tables unclean and every second food dish empty - obviously there was not enough personnel. I would rate this as 2 star hotel and would never pay 180 for a double room. Look for offers or somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: rajooj
Reviews.Content: Was very impressed with the way the room interior / decor. Loved the wall posters in the rooms. Great place to stay if you want to be close to everything as a tourist in Amsterdam's city center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: i-Luv-Travelgd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel citadel for about 3 weeks and enjoyed our time there. This was especially the case due to the fantastic staff. Joeren is absolutely fantastic and really made our trip in Amsterdam very special. As a result we were able to see the real Amsterdam including the oldest pub and schnapps house. What a brilliant guy! Location was perfect for us as we enjoy walking. So much to see and do and all at your doorstep. A short walk to Central station, the main red light district and many other beautiful areas such as Joordan. The room was comfortable with a desk and view over the bustling street. I did notice that some of the other rooms were a little smaller then ours and they may not have been as comfortable as a result. New beds were being rolled out to all rooms during our stay. Very comfortable beds and linen. Although all beds are two singles which are pushed together to make a double. Breakfast was very good and the staff were very helpful. A great experience all round!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Scootertt
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased to have lucked out with this one. The room was spacious enough for the three of us. The amenities were good. It's location is perfect - close to everything. I would highly recommend it and would try to say there again if I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: melker22
Reviews.Content: Glad we stayed here. Great room with view of rooftop Amsterdam - small but perfectly serviceable. Excellent shower, flat screen TV, hairdryer, etc. Good lift/elevator. Desk clerks friendly and helpful. Breakfast perfectly adequate - plenty of choice - good quality. With window open city noises. We bought an amsterdam card, the trams leave from right in front of the hotel, and the city was our oyster. Excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jammin63
Reviews.Content: I stay in Amsterdam quite often on business. I usually go for the cheapest reasonable hotel near the station. This hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the station and had the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. Could not fault it - fairly basic with a typically simple Dutch breakfast. Room seemed clean and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dynamite155
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and the staff are friendly and helpful. Our room (3 sharing) was quite small but Very clean and the beds were very comfortable. I could not hear any noise from out side. The location is perfect close to central station and tram lines. The breakfast was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Dan_travels_alot
Reviews.Content: the location is amazing, its hardly a seven minute stroll from Ams Centraal St and very close to all major tourist attractions. I booked a single room and found it clean, nice and cozy. The room had a flat screen tv with a few basic channels plus a kettle and a few packets of instant coffee and dairy whitener etc on the house. The lady who checked me in was very nice and polite, she even gave me a map of the city and answered to all my questions about what to see and where to go. Upon request i was even provided with a converter plug for my laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Very small lobby and even smaller room. A no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Actuarial_Math
Reviews.Content: Hotel Citadel has very good location of about 500m from the Amsterdam Centraal Station. It has 7 floors, with some rooms overlooking the Nieuwezjids Voorburgwal street, where trams ply. At night, the trams can be nois, espcially with the ringing of the honks, and even pedestrians' loud talking. The lobby is very small with 1 small arm-chair for guests to rest. The single room was very small. When I opened the toilet door, I can't get into the room or I can't open the cupboard. The space is enough for 1 single bed, with a very small strip for me to walk between the bed and desk. The Internet access costs EUR2 for 2 hours, which guests can use accumulatively. However, the speed is very slow, and it takes many minutes to connect properly before I can use it. This eats into the 2-hour rental. The very small safe in the room, which is big enough for a passport and wallet goes for EUR3.50 per day. The hotel serves cold breakfast only. The only hot items are the hard boiled eggs, toast which guests have to do it themselves, coffee, and tea. The hotel has good location though. It's 5 minutes to the very new shopping centre Magna Plaza and the New Church, and about 10 minutes to the Flower Market. It's also very near to the pedestrian-only shopping belt Kalfsvelstraat, and the row of cheap eats near to Damrak. I managed to pop in at the Avenue Hotel, which I wanted to book, too. it has a much biger looby with many sofas and chairs. The safe boxes, which are big enough for laptops, are near the lobby, It's also by daily rental.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.....but don't book a single room !!”
Reviews.Author: Christian4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an ideal position. I booked online and was horrified to see the room they gave me. It was the smallest room ever. i upgraded for 20 euros a night, i didnt want to pay anymore money but i didnt want to live in a shoe box either ! Breakfast was ok and so was the service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room with good location”
Reviews.Author: happynhawaii
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, I'm surprised by the complaints because my room was cute, spotless, comfortable (with flat screen TV) and very quiet. I walked in to this hotel because the place I'd originally booked was unavailable. They quoted me an excellent rate, which was a very good value for what I received. It was in an excellent location, within walking distance from the central train station, and close to all the nightlife. Service was incredibly friendly and helpful. Breakfast was sparse, but fine overall. The ambiance of the restaurant was very cozy and adorable. I enjoyed my stay and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much!”
Reviews.Author: csm54
Reviews.Content: Twin room was very small with very odd shower/toilet room. Nothing like the photos on the website, very basic with single glazing, even with windows open it was very stuffy. Breakfast unremarkable, it seemed to be rather cheap produce. Beds comfortable. We thought it expensive for what was on offer. Good points - very central, room at the back of hotel quiet even with windows open. No coffee facilities in room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Salathon
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in good location, staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was really nice. Bathroom VERY small but hey, how long are you gonna spend in a bathroom?!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: AB_Dbx
Reviews.Content: Situated near to the central station, nice room, and good staff

Reviews.Title: “good budget business place”
Reviews.Author: OKOKOKOKOKOK
Reviews.Content: Location is everything for me and in this case I needed to participate at a conference in the Krasnapolsky on Dam square (very centrally located) and I found this budget hotel with perfect location. Really small one-bed-room but at 62 Euro per night it was cheap for Amsterdam and everything was clean and proper. Breakfast buffet was good, wifi Internet costs 2 â‚¬ / hour or 3â‚¬ / 2 hours. Nothing fancy, but if you just need a bed, it will serve it's purpose well...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, good location, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: WiscoPat
Reviews.Content: Great location a couple blocks from the Damrak, close to everything. Tram stops right by the hotel so its easy to get to the Museumplein, Heinekin, etc easily. Right by Centraal station as well (5 min walk). Good breakfast, bathroom shower kind of odd, TV nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MistiLondon
Reviews.Content: Had to find a hotel at the very last minute when my company forgot to book me one! This was especially difficult as there was a world cup match on and the whole of Scotland seemed to be there! This hotel had a last minute cancellation (I tried twice upon recommendation of another hotel). The hotel is 5 mins from Dam Square, has the tram outside, the staff are pleasant and helpful, place was very clean, I had a lovely balcony over the front - which was a hint noisy but I liked it! Breakfast was simple but plentiful. I paid â‚¬175 (but it was the only room left anywhere!) if you can get a deal at this hotel I would definitely go for it! Perfectly acceptable for busines travel too.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, cheap and central”
Reviews.Author: lorraine830
Reviews.Content: I went here in January with one of my friends to experience Amsterdam from all the rave reviews. We went there without booking anything in advance as it always works out cheaper. We went into one of the tourist offices and she booked us in there. Good location near dam square and the red light district but far away if you intend on walking to any of the bars and clubs. The room was spacious for 2 people with 2 single beds and a t.v that had MTV which kept me happy. The walls could do with a bit of a paint but didnt bother me much. I work in a 4* hotel with extremely high standards so its pretty hard to please me when it comes to hotels. If you dont like the idea of staying in hostels the this is the next best thing. Clean and comfortable and affordable. Would recommend it for budget breaks. Helpful staff too. Good job as the city is overrun with hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JOLOU64
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 2 nts with my partner and friends. Hotel in good area about 7 mins from central station 5 mins walk to dam square.Arrived at 10.30 am couldnt check in till two which was no problem as we left our bags in room provided and went out to explore.Rooms are basic but clean flat screen tvs in room with a few english channels bathroom has bath with shower,as in previous reviews was quite noisey with the trams flying past all night [hotel is on main road with busy tram lines outside] other than the noise we had a good stay didnt get up for breakfast so cant comment on that.Staff were helpful all in all a good central but basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: aotearoanz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to all the main attractions of Amsterdam. The tram lines are just outside and Central Station a few minutes walk away. It is easy to get to any location from here. The rooms are clean and tidy as is the bathroom, but somewhat small. They are okay for a couple of nights but any longer you could feel a bit caged in. Breakfast is good with a selection of cereals, breads, cold meat and cheese. More than enough to start the day and was well replenished. The staff are friendly and helpful and were happy to give directions to various locations for us.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs....”
Reviews.Author: lenners
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during midsummer season, I had stayed in many 3 star hotels in Amsterdam before but this has to be the worst one, It was right beside the tramline so you had the ongoing drill of the tram bell late into the night and at early hours. The TV's signal also cut out and scrambled when a tram passed by. Around 7 am after a sleepless night the cleaning trolley crashed into my door, and kept repeatingly tapping off my door for about 30 mins. During the early hours of the morning of my third nights stay I was awoken by arguing going on in the corridor which carried on for about 15 minutes. There is also no air con in the hotelroom which isn't good for the middle of the summer, I couldn't leave a window open as I was on the first floor and due to the increase of noise from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: tricia27
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel has gotten some poor reviews lately, but I booked this hotel for daughter with a good experience here. She is very sensitive to dirt, mold, smells, etc and had no problems. Its a budget 3* (their triple room including breakfast was 270Euros for 2 night stay). The room was clean, convenient location within minutes walk of Centraal Station and Dam Sq, with trams across street. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “4 letter word for a 3 star hotel - DUMP”
Reviews.Author: ecbmdpsych
Reviews.Content: This hotel may have a 3 star rating but it should really have a 0 star. Just 4 letters to describe this hotel, which should sum it up pretty accurately... a "DUMP," despite its central location in the Amsterdam Centraal Station, Damrak and Dam Square area. The saving grace is the buffet continental breakfast, which is the highest rating for this hotel a "2 star" breakfast. The room was literally a closet, somewhat foul smelling, and the shower was like a public shower in the "ghetto." It is the only hotel that I stayed in where I was asked if I wanted the room cleaned... I always thought this was the routine for hotels is that the housekeeping staff cleans the room up daily. The funny and disgusting part of it was that housekeeping DID NOT clean our room for the 3 days we were there. With the above, I'll let you decide whether this DUMP is worth staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 15mins looked at two rooms gagged on the smell and left!!!”
Reviews.Author: gb306
Reviews.Content: ****Terrible, disgusting, one of the worst hotels we have nearly stayed at!!!******** After reading the reviews on here we where excited. It sounded like a reasonable hotel in a good location how wrong were we!!!... We decided to pay a little more for the last night of a mini Europe trip and decide to splash out 175 Euro's or Â£120 on a double en-suite room with breakfast. The location is 10mins from dam square and 10mins from the central station. At the front of the hotel is a tram line that at night time seemed noisy (by night time we had settle in the lovely Canal House Hotel we'll get to the reasons why in a moment...) So location next to the tram line not good, this sounds picky however the colour of the building didn't make it look like the cleanest hotel either. Hotel reception was basic, like any other and a bar at the same time. Our first concern came when we where asked to pay for the room before we had seen it, We did, took our key, made comment to each other about it however as we where tired headed up to our Â£120 room longing for a lay down and a shower. We got to the room opened the door and woof, the stench hit us stale cigarettes and smoke to the point that we where gagging the carpets and bed where dirty the room was basic and the walls had marks all over them, the bathroom was the pittiest attempt of a wet room I've ever seen. There was no shower cubicle just a curtain separating you from the sink and toilet. The room was so very basic, we immediately decided to ask for another room of which was just as bad therefore we collected our belongings and left. I implore everyone never stay at this hotel!!! its disgusting!!!, the one good thing the hotel done was to give us our money back straight away. Be warned guys this hotel is terrible!!!! If you want to stay some where beautiful try the Canal House Hotel simply magical.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all”
Reviews.Author: smockford
Reviews.Content: We too were let down by another online reservation company who hadn't sent our confirmation off to the relevant hotel. So stranded in Amsterdam we were given this Hotel as a spare by the Hotel info shop in Damrak Straat. We found the staff friendly and helpful, the rooms more than adequate for our needs, the maid service efficient and the breakfast comprehensive. I would have no hesitation returning there for another visit and would reccommend this for any short break stopovers.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: emtrs99
Reviews.Content: having been let down by another hotel (see my review of hotel kasteelen)and left wandering amsterdam late at night after a flight delay, we went on the off chance to the citadel.we were greeted by a very helpful receptionist who gave us a room at a good rate inc breakfast,although very grateful for a room at this time of night, it was on the small side and smelt a bit of cigarettes and overlooked a concrete wall,so the next morning i asked at reception if they had a room on the front,this was arranged with the minimum of fuss.although previous reports have mentioned the trams this is not really a problem unless you go to bed early. but why do that when your in amsterdam you can go to bed early at home!!! hotel is close to central station,dam square,canals,shops,several museums and the red light district. overall a good basic hotel with friendly helpful staff in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: PaulMcGlossop
Reviews.Content: Seven of us turned up on the doorstep of the Citadel Hotel, they were able to accomodate us and we were not dissappointed by this hotel. The rooms were clean, tidy and of a good size. The public areas, while small were also clean and tidy. The staff were very helpful and efficient. The room price included breakfast, which was of a high standard and quite varied. The location was ideal, within about ten minutes walk from Centraal Stn and a couple of minutes from Damrak. We noticed that most of the other guests were either couples or families. I am planning to return to Amsterdam again, this time with my wife and will book this hotel if available. As far as noisy trams are concerned then i suggest you do not visit european cities as they all seem to have them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: macala17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Citadel for 3 nights 11th - 14th February. As previously stated by others the noise at the front of the hotel is loud at nights, especially the trams, though got used to it after the first night. Breakfast was fine, staff were fine, and the building it'self is very Dutch. The location is fantastic, and the over riding reason to stay here. A five minute walk with cases from Central Station, and within easy walking distance of all central Amsterdam has to offer. If you can put up with the noise, this is an ideal hotel to stay at for a short break. Alternatively pre book a room at the rear. I would stay here again if I go back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortble triple”
Reviews.Author: Colthillmax
Reviews.Content: The three of us have just returned form a very pleasant stay at the Citadel. It is centrally located and easily walkable from the station with your cases. Our room contained three single beds , ample hanging and shelf space for 3 nights, a bath with shower and lots of hot water. Located at the rear of the hotel we heard no trams or anything else. We ate at a different restaurant each night and all were good and nearby. Great variety of museums and lots to keep everyone busy for the stay. We would reccomend the Citadel to families.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal no problems with this hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: WalesWelshgirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Citadel we had a late arrival, was only a 5 minute walk from the central station, more or less straight down the road, just to the right of the dam rak. Rooms clean, fine as a base, showers were good, my friend had a wonky room on the top floor in the gables., this had a fab city view but the walls felt like they were closing in but reception moved her without any problems, breakfast was fab, plenty of choice. Hotel was very accomodating they will bring breakfast up to your room for an extra 5 euro. We booked through hotelconnect.co.uk. and had 3 nights for the price of 2. Great location, plenty of bars and restaurants nearby and only a short walk from the red light district if you want to see it. Tram stops straight out side the hotel, also it was next to the big police station so quite a safe place to stay in that respect.

Reviews.Title: “claustrophobia!”
Reviews.Author: ministrygr
Reviews.Content: Never take the on-line offer for a single room (they show no photo!!!!) unless you like living in an elevator!!! single room too small and for this reason overpriced. I wonder, aren't they ashamed of asking this money for this room??

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: QTC
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel that probably has never been renewed. Anyway, the rooms were confortable and the shower worked and this, for me, it's enough. The location is great, 2 minutes away from the Dam Platz (city centre) and no more than 5 minutes from the red light district. Certainly is not a 3 stars hotel, but if you are young and you're going to Amsterdam to do the same I did, I promise that it is enough!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: mary023
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hotel citadel just a few weeks ago, all the rooms were clean and the location was perfect to explore the city on foot day or night. however it lacks any wow factor but is clean. Breakfast was good and at least you can get a deacent cup of tea! the area around the hotel is well lit and plesent to walk around. If breakfast is to early a small shop near by sells pasteries, water and juice as well as several cafe's.

Reviews.Title: “Urgh ... the noise ...”
Reviews.Content: You have a choice - if you want a no-smoking room, your room will be on the first couple of floors and your ears will be assaulted by the noise of the trams passing by your window late into the night. As the previous reviewer stated, ear plugs are all you need. If you can suffer the smell of stale smoke, you will have a more quiet night. The rooms are clean, basic but functional. Our twin room had the beds pushed together with white duvets. The sheets are clean with the odd faded stain. Our bathroom had been upgraded with a nice powerful jet shower. We also had a brand new TV - whereas there was no PAY TV, there are still a dozen channels, some of which were in English. There is a lift that takes you up to the higher floors. The guests seemed to be a mixture of tourists and business people. Breakfast is served downstairs in the small lobby and is absolutely fine (7-10am). Three types of cereal, two types of cheese, three types of cold meat, croissants, brown bread and raisin bread, all sorts of herbal and fruit teas and coffee, as well as orange and apple juice. There are 10 tables available for breakfast, we went down at 8am and it was fine, at busy times, you may need to wait for a table. The hotel is 10 minutes walk from the Centraal train station and about 5 minutes walk from the Dam. It is situated on a main street with shops and restaurants with lots more within easy reach. There are a few 'coffee shops' around but we never encountered any problems, and felt safe for the whole duration of our trip. I consider the hotel suitable for children.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Dimm_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night in this hotel and as other reviews had said the noise from the trams outside is quite bad. Saying that the room and shower/toilet were clean enough if rather small. The bed was definatley small. I looked out onto the main street and a tram must go rattaling past every 5 minutes so take some ear plugs or ask for a room at the back. Cost was â‚¬110 when booked on internet

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Jollibabe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel 6th and 7th of May, had early flight and arrived at hotel at 10a.m, tried to book in but strict rules, 2pm earliest. Room was not ready and had to wait until 3 to get in, this was a nightmare as we needed some sleep in order to get back out and see the town. When we finally got in we tried to get our heads down, the room window was directly next to the housekeeping shed and above the lobby, it had only just been finished and they had sprayed what seemed to be a full can of airfreshener which was thick in the air, hard to breath, there was a massive row and arguments in this area for what seemed like ages, the housekeeper was scrubbing something right outside the window and the sound was terrible, this went on for what seemed like hours. the room itself was ok'ish but small and dingy, no views and no direct light. One good point was the location, it was right in the centre with easy access to everything. on finally getting back to the hotel at 3am after a good night, (Amsterdam is Great) we got our heads down, however guess what, at 9am prompt the housekeeper was back in his little shed, sleep? NO CHANCE. the final insult was that when we booked this room we were told by the receptionist it was 130 euros, on checking out we found that the price was 160, On making these comments in full to to receptionist in writing we got a lovely comment, basically this is how it is, no apoligy offered and certainly no offer to put things right, Would I go back. NO CHANCE.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: lizzy217
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room, it was small but we were able to fit all our stuff. It has a nice size bathroom with toiletries (not the best, but none the less). We had a room in the back so noise was never an issue, although if you stay at the front of the hotel it might be. It was very clean and deserved its 3 stars. Breakfast was included in our rate and I have to say they were plentiful: bread, cheese , yougurt, cold cuts, coffee, jams, hard boiled eggs, etc. What I most loved about the place was the central location. We were able to walk everywhere or catch a tram in front of the hotel. Will be staying here again when we return. THe only down side is that tey did not provide internet access on site.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go, redecorating around guests.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were really dissapointed. The first room offered was at the front and very noisy due to tram lines. Next room was tiny. In both rooms disgusting basins with cracked enamel. These were being replaced while we were there, so at 9.30 every morning the plumber starting bashing about.This also meant no water from about 10am for an unspesified time. On top of this they were having the breakfast room redecorated which meant we had to be squashed into an area with very little room between tables and so many squashed in some people were almost in the corridor. While watching the cement dust cover the breakfast trolley the workmen and hotel staff used the toilets that opened out onto the eating area. We were so fed up we moved to the hotel just up the road.

Reviews.Title: “got a good deal so went to the Citadel”
Reviews.Author: p13urton_123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights from 10 to 14 March. We actually chose it because we got a good deal with one of the internet companies who were offering 4 nights for the price of 3. On arrival we were given a room on the 6th floor with a view over the road. We were pleased as we had read some reports of rooms lower down being noisy from the trams that stop right outside and noise from the hotel kitchen very early in the morning. Unfortunately this particular room smelt strongly of cigarette smoke. There was no hesitation in giving us another room, in fact were given keys to two other rooms and we could go and choose ourselves which room we would like. The other room on this floor overlooking the road was very small so we chose a much larger one at the back, which still had a nice view and was probably even quieter. Could have done with higher bulb wattage though, very difficult to read in the room and the sink really does need updating in line with the rest of the room and hotel. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant and always remembered which room were were in when asking for our key. There was a good choice at breakfast with the usual choice of cereals, hard boiled eggs, cheeses and meats with plenty of choice of breads (which could be toasted), rolls, croissants (although these ran out quickly) and fruit bread. This hotel is so convenient for everything, there are 5 trams that stop right outside, a lovely little pub on the corner 4 houses down. We had a very enjoyable stay here and loved Amsterdam. Hope to come back one day and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was so excited when I got to Amsteradm and ready to experience all the this city had to offer. But I was not at all ready for the nasty, tiny bathroom that we had. The hotel is located near a lot of attractions ie, The Red Light District, The Train Station, Restaurants ect, but it is just not what I am accustomed to! The shower was not only small but nasty the sink had scrapes in it and very dirty looking. When I asked for more towels I was told by the front desk attendant "I will see what i can do. " I am still waiting on those towels. It smells like an ash tray in the hall way. I know what AMsterdam is all about but when I go to a hotel I expect a little more than what I received. If ever I am in AMsterdam again I will not stay at this hotel! Don't go, I am sure there is something a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Citadel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My cousins and I booked a 2 night break and were very impressed with the quality of the hotel. Bath (proper not continental) with overhead shower, spotlessly clean. Breakfast - cereals, tea, coffee, cakes, jams, rolls, boiled eggs etc and extremely helpful staff. Because we arrived early, bags were kept whilst we sampled the guided walking tour - definitely recommended. Excellent hotel only 8 mins walk from the station and within easy walking distance of shops, station, canal boats etc. Next door to police station!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with great central location in Nieuwezijds Voorburgwhal. Five tramlines stop virtually outside the front door. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The shower didn't drain properly but this was minor really. I would certainly visit again. It was at least 1000% better than the dreadful Hotel Multitali where we stayed last time!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked ourselves here last October (2003) as part of an online package. The rooms, while small and "no-frills," were clean and comfortable; the bathroom was "European style": toilet, sink, shower head mounted to the wall, with only a curtain partitioning it off. (I mention this for first-time American travelers, particularly, who might be taken by surprise by this arrangement.) The breakfast (included) consisted of bread and rolls, cheese, eggs, cereal; juice, tea, coffee. The neighborhood, while having some seedy aspects to it, was safe, centrally located, and there was a tram stop directly across from the hotel. In all, a sound value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. In a really good location - it's only a 5 to 10 minute walk to any part of the city (including the main train station), and the hotel is right next to a police station, so it was quiet and safe. Also, there are trams almost right out the front. We had a double room with bath on the 4th floor which was very nice. The room was at the back of the hotel, and we didnâ€™t hear any street noise. Staff were friendly enough. Breakfast was good, but not great. All up a decent enough place to stay, safe and a great location. Could be cheaper, but everything is a little expensive in Amsterdam (except for the coffeeshops of course).

Reviews.Title: “Good "bang for the buck"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Citadel is a great value property located near Dam Square, Central Station, etc. The rooms are smallish (typical for the city) but the staff is superb. I've stayed twice and liked it each time!

Reviews.Title: “Very well placed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very well placed, five minutes walking of the Damm square , the red district and the central train station. There is a tram just fifty meters away of the hotel. So, if you donÃ‚Â´t want to listen the noise of the trams, request a room in the back of the hotel or in the highest floors.The room that we had has a good size, with tv and safe. The bath was not as good as the room. The furniture a little 70 years style, but in good state.The breakfast normal-good, with jam, cheese, cereals, yoghourt, differente cakes, etc. The staff very nice and useful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice for a European hotel. the rooms are small and they have limited television stations, but i came to Amsterdam to go see sights and have fun not sit in my room. the staff was very nice and the breakfast was good. i would /will stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Citadel
HotelInfo.Address: Nieuwezijds Voorbrugwal 100, Amsterdam 1012 SG, The Netherlands
